EmailTemplate.name: Tracker Newsletter.PROD STACK DEC 4
EmailTemplate.subject: [12/4 Webinar] Setting Priorities: How to Balance Planned vs. Unplanned Work
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Does this sound familiar: As a product manager, you’ve finally got a groomed backlog that aligns with the product vision and roadmap. Teams are cranking away and delivering. Everything is on track and then it happens—some unplanned work pops up that is deemed URGENT by someone outside your department. All eyes are on you to set the priority—do you have the tools to do it?
Join our panel discussion for tips, tricks, and answers, as The Product Stack welcomes Teresa Torres, Product Discovery Coach and founder of Product Talk; Aloka Penmetcha, Director of Product Management at Pivotal; and Jim Semick, Co-Founder of ProductPlan.
Here's what you'll learn if you attend:
- What to do when unplanned work pops up - Proven prioritization frameworks to help you tame the never-ending feedback chaos - How to communicate delays to stakeholders - Roadmapping best practices for agile dev teams
Submit your questions when you register, and we'll address as many as possible during the webinar.
RSVP <[[https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/127030271810031105?source=pivotal]]>
THE PANEL
Teresa Torres is a product coach helping teams adopt user-centered, hypothesis-driven product development practices. She works with companies of all sizes on integrating user research, experimentation, and the right analytics into the product development process resulting in better product decisions.
Aloka Penmetcha is a Director of Product Management at Pivotal Software and has deep experience dealing with the thorniest of management issues from inspiring people and teams to logically prioritizing business needs to continuously deliver measurable value.
Jim Semick is Co-Founder and Chief Strategist of ProductPlan. For over 15 years, he has helped establish pricing and launch new products now generating hundreds of millions in revenue. He was part of the founding team at AppFolio, a vertical SaaS company. Prior to AppFolio, Jim validated and helped launch GoToMyPC and GoToMeeting (acquired by Citrix). Jim is a frequent speaker on product management and the process of discovering successful revenue models.
